What's New with Woo
WooCommerce 9.3 is here. This release contains a number of optimizations to coming soon mode - including a new filter for extension pages, visibility updates, and the end of unnecessary front-end queries - as well as improved product checkbox UI, better shortcode checkout accessibility, and a whopping 27% reduction in WooCommerce plugin size.
See what changed

New in our Marketplace

Simplify multi-channel selling
Say goodbye to the headache of managing and tracking inventory at scale.
SkuVault Core helps stores manage stock, orders, and your warehouse in one place, reducing fulfillment time by up to 87%. Plus, with automatic product syncing every 12 hours, they'll never oversell again!
Boost my efficiency
Boost my efficiency

Print on demand, risk-free
Help clients bring designs to life as custom embroidery and print items, no inventory or upfront costs needed.
With 340+ products to choose from, high-quality printing, and white-label shipping, Printful handles all production and fulfillment logistics as businesses build and expand.
Connect with Printful
Connect with Printful

Bite-sized updates
  • Love a good deal? So do we! Get more for your money each Wednesday with big savings on selected extensions in our Marketplace. These offers change weekly, so once they're gone, they're gone. Don't miss this chance to level stores up with extra features and functionality. Shop this week's deals.
  • Note that WooCommerce 9.3.1 has the current stable tag, as we paused the planned remote error logging feature until the next release.
  • MailPoet 5.0 has arrived - with a number of updates under the hood including better WordPress alignment and simplified database connection. See what's new.
  • Looking to become an official agency partner to some of the most trusted brands in the WordPress ecosystem? Sign up for Automattic for Agencies to see how you can earn a listing on our new agency directory.
  • Trust matters for online brands - no matter the size. Learn how stores can increase customer confidence and boost sales with this recent webinar from the experts at Norton.

Run your store from anywhere

This email was sent to support@wolfiq.com.au. You're receiving it because you opted in when creating an account, submitting a form, or checking out on WooCommerce.com.

No longer want to receive these emails? Update your preferences or unsubscribe. You may still receive transactional and/or account-related emails from WooCommerce.com.

WooCommerce, Inc. is located at 60 29th St #343, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA.
